course-platforms.html.title: Course Platforms
course-platforms.html.description:
Coursera
Website: Coursera
Description: Offers courses, specializations, and degrees from universities and companies worldwide. Topics range from computer science and data science to arts and humanities.
Features: Many courses are free to audit, with options to pay for certificates or full degrees.
edX
Website: edX
Description: Provides a wide range of courses from top universities and institutions globally, including MIT, Harvard, and Microsoft. Covers various subjects including STEM, business, and humanities.
Features: Free courses available, with paid options for certificates and micro-degrees.
Udemy
Website: Udemy
Description: A vast marketplace for learning and teaching online where you can find courses on almost any subject taught by instructors from around the world.
Features: Often offers discounts on courses, and once purchased, you have lifetime access to the material.
Khan Academy
Website: Khan Academy
Description: Non-profit educational organization providing free online courses, lessons, and practice in subjects like math, science, and humanities.
Features: Completely free with a strong focus on K-12 education and some college-level content.
LinkedIn Learning (formerly Lynda.com)
Website: LinkedIn Learning
Description: Offers a wide range of professional courses on business, technology, and creative skills taught by industry experts.
Features: Subscription-based with a one-month free trial, and integration with LinkedIn profiles.
FutureLearn
Website: FutureLearn
Description: Offers online courses from leading universities and institutions worldwide. Topics cover a wide array of subjects including technology, business, health, and more.
Features: Many free courses, with options to pay for certificates and unlimited access.
Pluralsight
Website: Pluralsight
Description: Focuses on technology-related courses, particularly software development, IT, data science, and cybersecurity.
Features: Subscription-based with a free trial, offers learning paths and skill assessments.
MIT OpenCourseWare
Website: MIT OpenCourseWare
Description: A free and open collection of material from thousands of MIT courses, covering virtually all areas of academia.
Features: Free access to course materials including lecture notes, exams, and videos.
Skillshare
Website: Skillshare
Description: Offers a wide range of courses focusing on creativity, design, entrepreneurship, and technology.
Features: Subscription-based with a free trial period, encourages project-based learning.
Codecademy
Website: Codecademy
Description: Specializes in coding and programming courses, offering interactive lessons on web development, data science, and more.
Features: Offers both free and pro membership options, with hands-on projects and quizzes.

steve-jobs-..-walter-isaacson.html.title: Steve Jobs .. Walter Isaacson
steve-jobs-..-walter-isaacson.html.description:
In the first 30 years of your life, you make your habits. For the last 30 years of your life, your habits make you. (Steve Jobs)
there are some people who are innately curious, forever little kids in their awe of life, but theyโre rare.
Your thoughts construct patterns like scaffolding in your mind. You are really etching chemical patterns. In most cases, people get stuck in those patterns, just like grooves in a record, and they never get out of them.
If you want to live your life in a creative way, as an artist, you have to not look back too much. You have to be willing to take whatever youโve done and whoever you were and throw them away.
The more the outside world tries to reinforce an image of you, the harder it is to continue to be an artist, which is why a lot of times, artists have to say, โBye. I have to go. Iโm going crazy and Iโm getting out of here.โ And they go and hibernate somewhere. Maybe later they re-emerge a little differently.
I think you still have to think differently to buy an Apple computer. The people who buy them do think different. They are the creative spirits in this world, and theyโre out to change the world. We make tools for those kinds of people ... a lot of people think theyโre crazy, but in that craziness we see genius.
We at Apple had forgotten who we were. One way to remember who you are is to remember who your heroes are.
Hereโs to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. Theyโre not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you canโt do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.
he learned that a properly run company could spawn innovation far more than any single creative individual ... โThe whole notion of how you build a company is fascinating. When I got the chance to come back to Apple, I realized that I would be useless without the company, and thatโs why I decided to stay and rebuild it.โ

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the closer connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make the graph appear more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_includePath.description: The path on the server from which this feature can be loaded

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded
